frqParts.text: Directions: Answers must be in essay form. Outline form is not acceptable. Labeled diagrams may be used to supplement discussion, but in no case will a diagram alone suffice. It is important that you read each question completely before you begin. A molecule of messenger RNA (mRNA) has just been synthesized in the nucleus of a human cell. (a) What types of modifications may occur to this RNA before it leaves the nucleus?
(b) Once in the cytoplasm, how is the mRNA translated to a protein?
(c) If the cell is a secretory cell, how is the protein from part (b) eventually targeted, packaged, and secreted to the exterior of the cell?
